page.title: 07The Quarryman's life. page 1
page.content:
{HOURS OF WORK.} 7.30 a.m._5.30p.m. Mondays to Fridays. 7.30 a.m._12 noon Saturday mornings from 1920 onwards:- 8.a.m._4.15p.m. in winter time. 8a.m._5.15p.m. other wise.
{THEIR CLOTHES.} At the begining of this century most of the men wore a white smock (jacket) a waist_coat and trousers of thick oat_meal_coloured corduroy. Each month these garments were scrubbed clean by the wives or mothers. Ties were not usually worn. On their heads the older men wore bowler hats or a soft felt hat, whilst the younger men favoured cloth caps and these gradually gained favour with all ages.In autumn and winter they wore a three quarter jacket on top of the smock. This was usually the jacket of an old suit.
